image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Nebraska; born in Hastings, Adams County, Nebr., February 23, 1937; graduated from Hastings High School, Hastings, Nebr.; B.S., Hastings College, Hastings, Nebr., 1959; M.A., University of Nebraska, Lincoln, Nebr., 1963; Ph.D., University of Nebraska, Lincoln, Nebr., 1965; Nebraska Army National Guard, 1960-1966; head football coach, University of Nebraska, 1972-1997; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2007); not a candidate for reelection, but was an unsuccessful candidate for the Republican nomination for Governor of Nebraska in 2006.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Osborne, Tom, and John E. Roberts. More than Winning: The Story of Tom Osborne. Nashville: T. Nelson, 1985. Reprint, Lincoln: University of Nebraska Press, 2009.
Osborn, Tom. Faith in the Game: Lessons on Football, Work and Life. New York: Broadway Books; Colorado Springs: WaterBook Press, c1999.

researchRecord.name: In the George Round Oral Histories, 1973-1982, 12 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: Persons interviewed include Tom Osborne on May 24, 1982.
